solution_line_template: If the second tallest building is half as tall as the first one's height of {first_building_height} feet, it is {first_building_height}/{half_divisor}= <<{first_building_height}/{half_divisor}={second_building_height}>>{second_building_height} feet tall.

If the third tallest building is half as tall as the second one's height of {second_building_height} feet, it is {second_building_height}/{half_divisor}= <<{second_building_height}/{half_divisor}={third_building_height}>>{third_building_height} feet tall.

If the fourth building is one-fifth as tall as the third one, it is {third_building_height}/{fifth_divisor}= <<{third_building_height}/{fifth_divisor}={fourth_building_height}>>{fourth_building_height} feet tall.

Therefore, all four buildings put together would be {first_building_height}+{second_building_height}+{third_building_height}+{fourth_building_height}= <<{first_building_height}+{second_building_height}+{third_building_height}+{fourth_building_height}={total_height}>>{total_height} feet tall.
